articles.title: Sabre-toothed cats cared for each other when injured, fossil evidence suggests - CBC.ca
articles.description: Researchers identified bone damage suggesting a cat lived a long life with hip dysplasia, which means it likely only could have survived with help from other animals.
articles.content: Scientists have found that the fossilized remains of an adult sabre-toothed cat show signs that it lived with a congenital hip condition, suggesting that it lived in a social group with other cats wh… [+4474 chars]

articles.author: AFP
articles.title: Vietnam gets angry over minister's gold-leaf Salt Bea steak - New Straits Times Online
articles.description: LONDON: A video showing a powerful Vietnamese official enjoying a bite of steak smothered in gold leaf at a luxury London restaurant has sparked online anger in the Southeast Asian country, where the average person earns a few dollars a day.
